WRITING.TEXT: Thanks! I'm not made of money, but we could afford up to $3200 a month in rent for the right location (not looking to buy until we've been there a while ). We have been all over the Big Island and we like Kailua-Kona the best. We would like to be near some good schools, too.

WRITING.TITLE: Just got approval from my company to work remotely. I'm moving to Hawaii!
WRITING.TEXT: Aiming to move in December/January. I'm a IT consultant so I would be flying to California (where we live now) every other month for a week in person. What's amazing is I'm able to keep my California salary, just as long as I stay productive and work 6 AM-2 PM. We have narrowed it down to Oahu or the Big Island. We have 2 girls (1 and 4), and a small dog. Might be long term, if we like it. Any advice? Questions? Anyone else done this?
"The grilling site" ...typos are fun, imagine the world's largest BBQ on this monster!
You might try /r/Hawaii since it has more Hawaii residents....

Finding a job was easy, but the job just isn't challenging or interesting. I actually make really good money, but I know I need to move on soon even if it means a pay cut. Kind of a "golden handcuffs" situation.

Same here, but I breezed through college, mostly because I chose a business degree. I didn't really understand what engineering was and now I realize I should have chosen an engineering major. I'm doing a ton of self-study to attempt to get an engineering job (software) and it's tough to make time for that with a full time job and 2 kids!
Cars. The amount of death they cause is insane!

Every car can do 100-0 instantaneously, given a strong enough wall. I agree with your sentiment through, braking is rarely the show-off factor of a car but it almost always the thing that saves your life.

Person to person is not going to end well, but some kind of system where you can report them to some kind of system where the sheer number of complaints would pile up for the really bad drivers and possibly get them off the road.

That's a leopard, not a cheetah.

I've got the Seaview 180, and I really like it. I usually have issues getting a good seal with traditional masks, but this one was a dream, no water building up under my nose. Diving to 5-8 feet is possible, but it's much more difficult because of all the air inside. Another caveat is that the view is slightly distorted due to the round viewing area, so that can throw off your ability to gauge distances.
I love to troll my wife with responses like this...

This will sound weird, but Crocs make a flip-flop (sorry I'm a Californian) which does not break, does not smell, and does not stain feet. They also stay comfortable for the whole day and have really good grip for rocky terrain. I got mine in Kailua-Kona in 2013 and I have used them regularly ever since then without any visible wear.

WRITING.TITLE: The better you do on the SAT's the harder college will be.
WRITING.TEXT: Assuming you go to the best college you could get into with that score... I know it's a major oversimplification.
Just like the "Starbucks war on Christmas" with their red holiday cup... There was literally one guy pissed about it and somehow it created a ton of backlash against the "outrage".

I wish all radio and podcast personalities would have a 5 minute video of them just talking on youtube or whatever so I know what to picture when I listen to them. I always picture SOMEONE and it's usually someone I know personally, not the person speaking.
And the handles should be distinct by type so you know which one you're getting when pulling them out of the dishwasher or a handful of utensils...
Useless at this point.

Honestly this is so incredibly rare... how many times have you as a driver had to made this decision? The only times I have heard of a car killing a group of people is when someone hits the gas instead of brake (they were never trying to save their own life), which is never going to happen with a self-driving car. The car should also be able to detect when approaching a populated area and drive much slower.

I was asked to professionally video the funeral for a 3-year-old friend, not realizing I would end up sobbing for the 2nd half of it (which can be heard in parts of the recording). Glad I had a tripod so I could step away and compose myself.
Giant killer starfish with yellow death-slime shooters? No shortage of imagination there...

A girl I dated in high school once said "I don't want to go to college, I'll just sing in coffee shops until I get discovered." She was definitely NOT a soloist... so she'd be playing that coffee shop until the day she died!

When my grandma (a musician) passed away and I was about 15, I also got an inheritance and used it to buy my first "real" electric guitar, an american-made lone star strat. 19 years later, I still have it!

WRITING.TITLE: Perfect is the enemy of good
WRITING.TEXT: Don't wait to show the world what you have until it's perfect, that time simply never comes.
